results.content:
Training lacks the technical details required for an experienced developer to learn the details of asynchronous coding for node.js. 

Video sessions were simply watching the instructor step-through limited technical topics without providing the details.

Audio and video quality were incosistent.

results.content:
I'm not sure I want to use async.js... looks cool, but didn't realize the lecture would be teaching a package...

[after course]
ah i see... so i got the async/await detail i was looking for.... did i miss the reason why i would ever use Async.js and not the async /await way?

Thanks!

response.content: You dont need to use Async.js. Async.js only works with callbacks. I would recommend you to use Async/Await. Async/Await always works with promises. If you have any question you can ask question in QA
response.content_html: You dont need to use Async.js. Async.js only works with callbacks. I would recommend you to use Async/Await. Async/Await always works with promises. If you have any question you can ask question in QA

results.content: Haider does a great job in the other two courses but its interesting that he chose to use a HTTP GET method to actually create an entity in the datastore to me that's quite weird .He should have also chosen a much simpler example in my opinion to explain the async.series task.Also for some weird reason the videos are not clear even in 720px .Hope you get the time to reshoot the video using a better setting and also use an HTTP POST method if you continue on using the example you are using.
results.content_html: Haider does a great job in the other two courses but its interesting that he chose to use a HTTP GET method to actually create an entity in the datastore to me that's quite weird .He should have also chosen a much simpler example in my opinion to explain the async.series task.Also for some weird reason the videos are not clear even in 720px .Hope you get the time to reshoot the video using a better setting and also use an HTTP POST method if you continue on using the example you are using.

results.content_html: Great introduction to the Async.js library and Promises and how to implement them!

results.content: The course does a good job of walking through the code. I would find it more clear if there was more explanation about the scopes and and naming patterns. It wasn't immediately clear to me why res was declared outside the array, but was used inside the arrays. I'm assuming it's accessible because the functions are closures with access to their parent's scope.
results.content_html: The course does a good job of walking through the code. I would find it more clear if there was more explanation about the scopes and and naming patterns. It wasn't immediately clear to me why res was declared outside the array, but was used inside the arrays. I'm assuming it's accessible because the functions are closures with access to their parent's scope.

results.content: I was lacking a bit in Asynchronous Calls in javascript and wanted to take this course to learn more about Asynchronous programming in javascript. I'm a Student and wants to advance my programming skills and this course really helps me to understand asynchronous programming,  I highly recommend this course to others interested in the same thing.
